tit.j: 京都府立農林専門学校 (旧制)
tit.e: Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the old system of education)
Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the old system of education)
Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the old system of education)

sen.j: 京都府立農林専門学校 （きょうとふりつのうりんせんもんがっこう） は、1944年 （昭和19年） に設立された公立の旧制専門学校。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry was a public vocational school founded under the old education system in 1944.
Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry was a public vocational school founded under the old education system in 1944.
Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry was a public vocational school founded under the old education system in 1944.

sen.j: 創立時の名称は京都府立高等農林学校。
sen.e: When established, it was called Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry.
When established, it was called the Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry.
When established, it was called the Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry.

sen.j: 本項では、京都府立農林学校など前身諸校を含めて記述する。
sen.e: This section describes the school, including its predecessors such as Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry.
This section describes the school, including its predecessors such as Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry.
This section describes the school, including its predecessors such as Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦中に農産体制増強のために設立された高等農林学校の一つ。
sen.e: It was one of the agriculture and forestry high schools established during World War II to enhance the agricultural system.
It was one of the agriculture and forestry high schools established during World War II to enhance the agricultural system.
It was one of the agriculture and forestry high schools established during World War II to enhance the agricultural system.

sen.j: 本科 （修業年限3年） に農科、林科を設置 （のち農芸化学科を増設）。
sen.e: The regular courses (3-year courses) were offered at the Department of Agriculture and Department of Forestry (Department of Agricultural Chemistry was added later).
The regular courses (3-year courses) were offered at the Department of Agriculture and Department of Forestry (Department of Agricultural Chemistry was added later).
The regular courses (three-year courses) were offered at the Department of Agriculture and Department of Forestry (Department of Agricultural Chemistry was added later).

sen.j: 京都府立高等農林学校として設立後まもなく京都府立農林専門学校と改称された。
sen.e: It was established under the name of Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry, but was soon renamed Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry.
It was established under the name of Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry, but was soon renamed Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry.
It was established under the name of Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry, but was soon renamed Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry.

sen.j: 新制（京都府立）西京大学農学部 （現 京都府立大学農学部） の前身である。
sen.e: The school evolved into the Faculty of Agriculture, (Kyoto Prefectural) Saikyo University (present-day Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto Prefectural University), which was established under a new education system.

The school evolved into the Faculty of Agriculture, (Kyoto Prefectural) Saikyo University (present-day Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto Prefectural University), which was established under the new education system.

The school evolved into the Faculty of Agriculture, (Kyoto Prefectural) Saikyo University (present-day Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto Prefectural University), which was established under the new education system.

sen.j: 同窓会は 「京都府立大学同窓会」 と称し、旧制・新制合同の会である。
sen.e: Its alumni association, "Alumni Association of Kyoto Prefectural University," is made up of graduates from schools under both new and old systems.
Its alumni association, "Alumni Association of Kyoto Prefectural University," is made up of graduates from schools under both new and old systems.
Its alumni association, 'Alumni Association of Kyoto Prefectural University,' is made up of graduates from schools under both new and old systems.

sen.j: 前史
sen.e: Prehistory
Prehistory
Prehistory

sen.j: 1892年： 京都府農会 （1891年10月設立）、府会から農事講習所開設の了承を得る。
sen.e: 1892: Kyoto Prefectural Nokai (agricultural association of Kyoto Prefecture; founded in October 1891) obtained approval from the Kyoto Prefectural Assembly to establish Agricultural Training Institute.

1892: Kyoto Prefectural Nokai (agricultural association of Kyoto Prefecture; founded in October 1891) obtained approval from the Kyoto Prefectural Assembly to establish Agricultural Training Institute.

1892: Kyoto Prefectural Nokai (agricultural association of Kyoto Prefecture; founded in October 1891) obtained approval from the Kyoto Prefectural Assembly to establish Agricultural Training Institute.

sen.j: 1892年12月： 府農会附設中央農事試験場を設立。
sen.e: December 1892: Central Agricultural Experiment Station was established for the Prefectural Nokai.
December 1892: The Central Agricultural Experiment Station was established for the Prefectural Nokai.
December 1892: The Central Agricultural Experiment Station was established for the Prefectural Nokai.

sen.j: 京都府農業総合研究所、京都府立大学附属農場の源流。
sen.e: The station is the origin of Kyoto Prefectural Research Institute of Agriculture and University Farm of Kyoto Prefectural University.
The station is the origin of the Kyoto Prefectural Research Institute of Agriculture and University Farm of Kyoto Prefectural University.
The station is the origin of the Kyoto Prefectural Research Institute of Agriculture and University Farm of Kyoto Prefectural University.

sen.j: 1893年4月： 京都府農会、農事講習所を開設。
sen.e: April 1893: Kyoto Prefectural Nokai opened Agricultural Training Institute.
April 1893: Kyoto Prefectural Nokai opened the Agricultural Training Institute.
April 1893: Kyoto Prefectural Nokai opened the Agricultural Training Institute.

sen.j: 巡回開講、1回につき半月～1ヶ月程度。
sen.e: It gave lecture tours of about half to one month each.
It gave rotating lecture tours each lasting about two weeks to one month.
It gave rotating lecture tours each lasting about two weeks to one month.

sen.j: 京都府簡易農学校時代
sen.e: Period of Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture
The Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture
The Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 1895年4月： 京都府簡易農学校設置 （京都府令第40号）。
sen.e: April 1895: Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture was opened (under the Order of Kyoto Prefecture No. 40).
April 1895: Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture was opened (under the Order of Kyoto Prefecture No. 40).
April 1895: Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture was opened (under the Order of Kyoto Prefecture No. 40).

sen.j: 簡易農学校規程 （文部省により1894年7月公布） に基づく。
sen.e: It was based on the Rules for Simplified Agricultural School (issued by the Ministry of Education in July 1894).
It was based on the Rules for Simplified Agricultural Schools (issued by the Ministry of Education in July 1894).
It was based on the Rules for Simplified Agricultural Schools (issued by the Ministry of Education in July 1894).

sen.j: 修業年限2年、入学資格： 満14歳以上、尋常小学校卒業以上。
sen.e: Those aged fourteen or over who at least had finished Jinjo elementary school were accepted into the school, and two years were required for completing a course of study.
Those aged fourteen or over who had finished at least Jinjo elementary school were accepted into the school, and two years were required for completing a course of study.
Those aged 14 or over who had finished at least Jinjo elementary school were accepted into the school, and two years were required for completing a course of study.

sen.j: 府農事講習所、京都府簡易農学校附属分教場となる。
sen.e: Prefectural Agricultural Training Institute became the Bunkyojo Classroom attached to Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture.
The Prefectural Agricultural Training Institute became the Bunkyojo Classroom attached to the Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture.
The Prefectural Agricultural Training Institute became the Bunkyojo Classroom attached to the Simplified Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 1896年4月： 補習科 （1年制） を設置。
sen.e: April 1896: A supplementary course (one-year course) was launched.
April 1896: A supplementary course (one-year course) was launched.
April 1896: A supplementary course (one-year course) was launched.

sen.j: 1896年9月： 葛野郡桂村に移転。
sen.e: September 1896: The school was relocated to Katsura Village, Kadono District.
September 1896: The school was relocated to Katsura Village, Kadono District.
September 1896: The school was relocated to Katsura Village, Kadono District.

sen.j: 府農会農事試験場も移転。
sen.e: Agricultural Experiment Station of Prefectural Nokai was also moved.
The Agricultural Experiment Station of Prefectural Nokai was also moved.
The Agricultural Experiment Station of Prefectural Nokai was also moved.

sen.j: 京都府農学校時代
sen.e: Period of Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture
The Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture
The Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 1898年4月： 京都府農学校と改称 （京都府令第36号）。
sen.e: April 1898: The school changed its name to Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture (under the Order of Kyoto Prefecture No. 36).
April 1898: The school changed its name to the Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture (under the Order of Kyoto Prefecture No. 36).
April 1898: The school changed its name to the Agricultural School of Kyoto Prefecture (under the Order of Kyoto Prefecture No. 36).

sen.j: 修業年限3年、入学資格： 満14歳以上、高等小学校卒業以上。
sen.e: Those aged fourteen or over who at least had finished higher elementary school were accepted into the school, and three years were required for completing a course of study.
Those aged fourteen or over who had finished upper elementary school were accepted into the school, and three years were required for completing a course of study.
Those aged 14 or over who had finished upper elementary school were accepted into the school, and three years were required for completing a course of study.

sen.j: 研究科 （1年制） を設置。
sen.e: Graduate program (one-year program) was set up.
Graduate program (one-year program) was set up.
Graduate program (one-year program) was set up.

sen.j: 1899年8月： 規則改正、研究科を専攻科に改組、予科を設置。
sen.e: August 1899: Due to the revision of regulations, the graduate program was reorganized into a non-degree course for graduates, and a preparatory course was newly added.
August 1899: Due to a revision of regulations, the graduate program was reorganized into a non-degree course for graduates, and a preparatory course was newly added.
August 1899: Due to a revision of regulations, the graduate program was reorganized into a non-degree course for graduates, and a preparatory course was newly added.

sen.j: 実業学校令、農業学校規程に基づき甲種農学校となる。
sen.e: Vocational School Order and Agricultural School Regulations designated the school as a class-A Agricultural School.
Vocational School Order and Agricultural School Regulations designated the school as a class-A Agricultural School.
Vocational School Order and Agricultural School Regulations designated the school as a class-A Agricultural School.

sen.j: 予科は修業年限1年、入学資格： 高等小学校第3学年修了程度。
sen.e: The preparatory course required one year for completion and admitted those who had finished their third year of the higher elementary school or those who had equivalent ability.
The preparatory course required one year for completion and admitted those who had finished their third year of upper elementary school or those who had equivalent ability.
The preparatory course required one year for completion and admitted those who had finished their third year of upper elementary school or those who had equivalent ability.

sen.j: 1900年2月： 府農会農事試験場、京都府農事試験場と改称。
sen.e: February 1900: Agricultural Experiment Station of Prefectural Nokai was renamed the Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural Experiment Station.
February 1900: The Agricultural Experiment Station of Prefectural Nokai was renamed the Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural Experiment Station.
February 1900: The Agricultural Experiment Station of Prefectural Nokai was renamed the Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural Experiment Station.

sen.j: 1901年3月： 附属分教場農事講習所、別科農事講習所となる。
sen.e: March 1901: Bunkyojo Classroom Agricultural Training Institute attached to the school became to be used for the school's special course.
March 1901: The Bunkyojo Classroom Agricultural Training Institute attached to the school became to be used for the school's special course.
March 1901: The Bunkyojo Classroom Agricultural Training Institute attached to the school became to be used for the school's special course.

sen.j: 京都府立農学校時代
sen.e: Period of Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural School
The Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural School
The Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural School

sen.j: 1901年9月： 京都府立農学校と改称 （文部省告示第405号）。
sen.e: September 1901: The school was renamed Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural School (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 405).
September 1901: The school was renamed Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural School (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 405).
September 1901: The school was renamed Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural School (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 405).

sen.j: 1902年5月： 乙訓郡大枝村の官有林の払下げを受け、実習林とする。
sen.e: May 1902: It purchased government-owned forest in Oe Village, Otokuni District, to use for practical training.
May 1902: It purchased government-owned forest in Oe Village, Otokuni District, to use for practical training.
May 1902: It purchased government-owned forest in Oe Village, Otokuni District, to use for practical training.

sen.j: 1903年4月： 規則改正、予科を2年制とする。
sen.e: April 1903: Revision of regulations increased the length of the preparatory course to 2 years.
April 1903: Revision of regulations increased the length of the preparatory course to 2 years.
April 1903: Revision of regulations increased the length of the preparatory course to two years.

sen.j: 本科第3学年を第1部 （農業）、第2部 （林業） に分け、補習科を設置。
sen.e: Third grade of the regular course was divided into first (agriculture) and second (forestry) departments, and a supplementary course was established.
Third grade of the regular course was divided into first (agriculture) and second (forestry) departments, and a supplementary course was established.
Third grade of the regular course was divided into first (agriculture) and second (forestry) departments, and a supplementary course was established.

sen.j: 京都府立農林学校時代
sen.e: Period of Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry
The Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry
The Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry

sen.j: 1904年4月： 京都府立農林学校と改称 （文部省告示第73号）。
sen.e: April 1904: The school was renamed Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 73).
April 1904: The school was renamed Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 73).
April 1904: The school was renamed Kyoto Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 73).

sen.j: 1904年10月： 校友会を設立。
sen.e: October 1904: The graduates' association was organized.
October 1904: The graduates' association was organized.
October 1904: The graduates' association was organized.

sen.j: 1907年3月： 予科・補習科を廃止。
sen.e: March 1907: Preparatory and supplementary courses were abolished.
March 1907: Preparatory and supplementary courses were abolished.
March 1907: Preparatory and supplementary courses were abolished.

sen.j: 1912年7月： 校友会を 「桂会」 と改称 （同窓会組織）。
sen.e: July 1912: Its graduates' association got a new name, "Katsura Kai"(an alumni organization).
July 1912: Its graduates' association got a new name, "Katsura Kai"(an alumni organization).
July 1912: Its graduates' association got a new name, 'Katsura Kai' (an alumni organization).

sen.j: 1918年3月： 愛宕郡下鴨村 （現 京都府立大学キャンパス） に移転。
sen.e: March 1918: The school moved to Shimogamo Village, Otagi District (present-day Kyoto Prefectural University Campus).
March 1918: The school moved to Shimogamo Village, Otagi District (present-day Kyoto Prefectural University Campus).
March 1918: The school moved to Shimogamo Village, Otagi District (present-day Kyoto Prefectural University Campus).

sen.j: 京都府農事試験場も種芸部を除き移転。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural Experiment Station, except the Arboriculture Division, was also relocated.
The Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural Experiment Station, except the Arboriculture Division, was also relocated.

sen.j: 京都府立京都農林学校時代
sen.e: Period of Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry
The Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry

sen.j: 1923年4月： 京都府立京都農林学校と改称 （文部省告示第35号）。
sen.e: April 1923: The name of the school was changed to Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 35).
April 1923: The name of the school was changed to the Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 35).

sen.j: 1924年11月： 府立農林学校卒業者大会、専門学校への昇格を決議。
sen.e: November 1924: The convention of the graduates of Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry passed a resolution to promote the school to a vocational school.
November 1924: A convention of graduates of the Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry passed a resolution to promote the school to a vocational school.
November 1924: A convention of graduates of the Prefectural School of Agriculture and Forestry passed a resolution to promote the school to a vocational school.

sen.j: 昇格は20年後まで実現せず。
sen.e: The promotion, however, was not realized for twenty years.
The promotion, however, was not realized for twenty years.
The promotion, however, was not realized for 20 years.

sen.j: 1928年5月： 本科第1部を農業科、第2部を農林科と改称。
sen.e: May 1928: First and second departments of the regular course were renamed Department of Agriculture and Department of Agriculture and Forestry, respectively.
May 1928: First and second departments of the regular course were renamed Department of Agriculture and Department of Agriculture and Forestry, respectively.
May 1928: First and second departments of the regular course were renamed Department of Agriculture and Department of Agriculture and Forestry, respectively.

sen.j: 1931年4月： 本科に園芸科を増設。
sen.e: April 1931: Department of Gardening was added to the regular course.
April 1931: Department of Gardening was added to the regular course.
April 1931: Department of Gardening was added to the regular course.

sen.j: 1932年4月： 農林科を廃止、第2部産業組合科 （修業年限1年） を設置。
sen.e: April 1932: Department of Agriculture and Forestry was abolished and Second Department of Industrial Association (one-year course) was established.
April 1932: Department of Agriculture and Forestry was abolished and Second Department of Industrial Association (one-year course) was established.
April 1932: Department of Agriculture and Forestry was abolished and Second Department of Industrial Association (one-year course) was established.

sen.j: 1934年4月： 農業科を農林科と改称。
sen.e: April 1934: Department of Agriculture was renamed Department of Agriculture and Forestry.
April 1934: Department of Agriculture was renamed Department of Agriculture and Forestry.
April 1934: Department of Agriculture was renamed Department of Agriculture and Forestry.

sen.j: 1934年9月： 室戸台風で校舎倒壊。
sen.e: September 1934: Muroto typhoon destroyed the campus.
September 1934: Muroto typhoon destroyed the campus.
September 1934: Muroto typhoon destroyed the campus.

sen.j: 1936年12月： 本館・体育館竣工。
sen.e: December 1936: Construction of a main building and gymnasium was completed.
December 1936: Construction of the main building and gymnasium was completed.
December 1936: Construction of the main building and gymnasium was completed.

sen.j: 1940年4月： 園芸科 5年制で新設。
sen.e: April 1940: Five-year Department of Gardening was opened.
April 1940: Five-year Department of Gardening was opened.
April 1940: Five-year Department of Gardening was opened.

sen.j: 1943年3月： 第2部産業組合科を廃止 （目的達成のため）。
sen.e: March 1943: Second Department of Industrial Association was abolished (because its objectives had been achieved).
March 1943: Second Department of Industrial Association was abolished (because its objectives had been achieved).

sen.j: 1944年2月22日： 専門学校令により京都府立高等農林学校設置認可 （文部省告示第149号）。
sen.e: February 22, 1944: Establishment of Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry was approved by the Acts of Colleges (Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 149).

sen.j: 京都府立京都農林学校からの昇格。
sen.e: It was a school upgraded from the Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry.
It was a school upgraded from the Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry.
It was a school upgraded from the Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry.

sen.j: 修業年限3年、本科に農科、林科を設置。
sen.e: It required three years of study and offered regular courses at the Department of Agriculture and the Department of Forestry.
It required three years of study and offered regular courses at the Department of Agriculture and the Department of Forestry.
It required three years of study and offered regular courses at the Department of Agriculture and the Department of Forestry.

sen.j: 旧制中学校卒業者のほか、中学4年修了者も入学が認められた。
sen.e: The school admitted graduates from the junior high school under the old system of education as well as those who had finished their fourth year of junior high school.

sen.j: 1944年7月26日： 京都府立農林専門学校と改称 （文部省告示第811号）。
sen.e: July 26, 1944: The school was renamed Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry (under the Public Notice of the Ministry of Education No. 811).

sen.j: 1948年4月： 本科に農芸化学科を設置。
sen.e: April 1948: Department of Agricultural Chemistry was added as a regular course.
April 1948: Department of Agricultural Chemistry was added as a regular course.

sen.j: 1948年7月： 文部省に府立農専・京都府立女子専門学校 (旧制)を母体とする新制 「府立京都大学」 設置申請。
sen.e: July 1948: An application was made to the Ministry of Education for establishing "Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto University" under the new system, based on the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry and Kyoto Prefectural Girls' Vocational Training School (under the old system of education).

July 1948: An application was made to the Ministry of Education for establishing the "Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto University" under the new system, based on the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry and Kyoto Prefectural Girls' Vocational Training School (under the old system of education).

July 1948: An application was made to the Ministry of Education for establishing the 'Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto University' under the new system, based on the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry and Kyoto Prefectural Girls' Vocational Training School (under the old system of education).

sen.j: 1949年2月11日： 文部省より新制府立大学設置認可。
sen.e: February 11, 1949: Ministry of Education approved the establishment of the prefectural university under the new system.
February 11, 1949: Ministry of Education approved the establishment of the prefectural university under the new system.
February 11, 1949: Ministry of Education approved the establishment of the prefectural university under the new system.

sen.j: ただし、名称が国立京都大学と紛らわしいため、3月8日に修正申請。
sen.e: But, as the name could be easily confused with the national Kyoto University's, the school applied for the change of its name on March 8.
But, as the name could be easily confused with the national Kyoto University's, the school applied for a name change on March 8.
But, as the name could be easily confused with the national Kyoto University's, the school applied for a name change on March 8.

sen.j: 1949年4月： 新制京都府立西京大学 （文家政学部、農学部） 発足。
sen.e: April 1949: Kyoto Prefectural Saikyo University was inaugurated under the new system (Faculty of Letters and Domestic Science and Faculty of Agriculture).
April 1949: Kyoto Prefectural Saikyo University was inaugurated under the new system (Faculty of Letters and Domestic Science and Faculty of Agriculture).
April 1949: Kyoto Prefectural Saikyo University was inaugurated under the new system (Faculty of Letters and Domestic Science and Faculty of Agriculture).

sen.j: 府立農専は農学部の母体となった。
sen.e: The Faculty of Agriculture was based on the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry.
The Faculty of Agriculture was based on the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry.
The Faculty of Agriculture was based on the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry.

sen.j: 1950年5月： 京都府立農業試験場、亀岡市へ移転のため、下鴨農場を西京大学に移管。
sen.e: May 1950: When Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural Experiment Station was relocated to Kameoka City, it transferred Shimogamo farm to the Saikyo University.
May 1950: When Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural Experiment Station was relocated to Kameoka City, it transferred Shimogamo farm to the Saikyo University.
May 1950: When Kyoto Prefectural Agricultural Experiment Station was relocated to Kameoka City, it transferred Shimogamo farm to the Saikyo University.

sen.j: 1951年3月： 旧制京都府立農林専門学校、廃止。
sen.e: March 1951: Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry under the old education system was closed.
March 1951: Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry under the old education system was closed.
March 1951: Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry under the old education system was closed.

sen.j: 前身諸校の時代
sen.e: Period of predecessors
Period of predecessors
Period of predecessors

sen.j: 1895年の簡易農学校発足時は京都府愛宕郡大宮村 （現京都市北区） の大徳寺の塔頭を借用。
sen.e: At the time of establishment in 1895, Simplified Agricultural School occupied the premises of the sub-temple of Daitoku-ji Temple in Omiya Village, Otagi District, Kyoto Prefecture (present-day Kita Ward, Kyoto City).

At the time it was establishment in 1895, the Simplified Agricultural School occupied the premises of the sub-temple of Daitoku-ji Temple in Omiya Village, Otagi District, Kyoto Prefecture (present-day Kita Ward, Kyoto City).

At the time it was establishment in 1895, the Simplified Agricultural School occupied the premises of the sub-temple of Daitoku-ji Temple in Omiya Village, Otagi District, Kyoto Prefecture (present-day Kita Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 翌1896年4月、葛野郡川岡村字川島 （現京都市西京区） の本派浄土真宗本願寺派西山別院に分校を設置。
sen.e: In April of the following year, i.e., 1896, it opened a branch school in Nishiyama branch temple of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) Hompa Hongwan-ji school located in Aza Kawashima, Kawaoka Village, Kadono District (present-day Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City).

In April of the following year, i.e., 1896, it opened a branch school in the Nishiyama branch temple of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) Hompa Hongwan-ji school located in Aza Kawashima, Kawaoka Village, Kadono District (present-day Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City).

In April of the following year, i.e., 1896, it opened a branch school in the Nishiyama branch temple of Jodo Shinshu sect (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) Honpa Hongwan-ji school located in Aza Kawashima, Kawaoka Village, Kadono District (present-day Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: sect 浄土真宗に追記Hompa→HonpaKadono の前のスペース短縮

sen.j: 同 6月には大徳寺から引き上げ、分校に移転。
sen.e: In June of that year, the campus in Daitoku-ji Temple was closed and integrated into the branch school.
In June of that year, the campus in Daitoku-ji Temple was closed and integrated into the branch school.
In June of that year, the campus in Daitoku-ji Temple was closed and integrated into the branch school.

sen.j: 同 9月に葛野郡桂村に校舎が完成、移転した （現 阪急電鉄桂駅北約200mの地点、阪急京都本線と阪急嵐山線の分岐付近）。
sen.e: The school moved to a new campus that was completed in September of the same year in Katsura Village, Kadono District (near the present point where Hankyu Kyoto Line and Hankyu Arashiyama Line meet at about 200 meters north of Hankyu Railway Katsura Station).

The school moved to a new campus that was completed in September of the same year in Katsura Village, Kadono District (near the present point where the Hankyu Kyoto Line and the Hankyu Arashiyama Line meet at about 200 meters north of Hankyu Railway Katsura Station).

The school moved to a new campus that was completed in September of the same year in Katsura Village, Kadono District (near the present point where the Hankyu Kyoto Line and the Hankyu Arashiyama Line meet at about 200 meters north of Hankyu Railway Katsura Station).

sen.j: 1918年には愛宕郡下鴨村 （現京都市左京区） に移転した。
sen.e: In 1918, the school was relocated to Shimogamo Village, Otagi District (present-day Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).
In 1918, the school was relocated to Shimogamo Village, Otagi District (present-day Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).
In 1918, the school was relocated to Shimogamo Village, Otagi District (present-day Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 京都府立高等農林学校、京都府立農林専門学校時代
sen.e: Period of Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry and Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry
The Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry and Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry
The Kyoto Prefectural Higher School of Agriculture and Forestry and Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry

sen.j: 前身の府立京都農林学校の下鴨校舎を引き継ぎ、廃止まで同地を使用した。
sen.e: The schools used Shimogamo campus of their predecessor, Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry, until the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry was abolished.

The schools used the Shimogamo campus of their predecessor, the Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry, until the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry was abolished.

The schools used the Shimogamo campus of their predecessor, the Kyoto Prefectural Kyoto School of Agriculture and Forestry, until the Kyoto Prefectural Vocational Training School of Agriculture and Forestry was abolished.

sen.j: 後身の新制西京大学農学部は同地で発足した。
sen.e: Their successor, Faculty of Agriculture, Saikyo University was established under the new education system at the same campus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Their successor, the Faculty of Agriculture, Saikyo University was established under the new education system at the same campus.
Their successor, the Faculty of Agriculture, Saikyo University was established under the new education system at the same campus.

sen.j: 1959年5月に京都府立大学と改称後も引き続き同地を使用し続けている。
sen.e: The University changed its name to Kyoto Prefectural University in May 1959, but is still in the same place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The University changed its name to Kyoto Prefectural University in May 1959, but is still in the same place.
The University changed its name to Kyoto Prefectural University in May 1959, but is still in the same place.

sen.j: 1936年12月に竣工した本館は、1979年に解体され、跡地には1980年5月に現在の本館・総合講義棟が建設された。
sen.e: The university's main building was completed in December 1936, but was demolished in 1979 to make way for the current Administration Building built in May 1980.
The university's main building was completed in December 1936, but was demolished in 1979 to make way for the current Administration Building built in May 1980.
The university's main building was completed in December 1936, but was demolished in 1979 to make way for the current Administration Building built in May 1980.

sen.j: 正門の門柱は 1936年頃建設のものが使用され続けている。
sen.e: Main gate pillars were set up around 1936 and have been used since then.
Main gate pillars were set up around 1936 and have been used since then.
Main gate pillars were set up around 1936 and have been used since then.
